question: What should a solutions architect do to ensure that all objects uploaded to an Amazon S3 bucket are encrypted?

options.A: Update the bucket policy to deny if the PutObject does not have an s3:x-amz-acl header set.
options.B: Update the bucket policy to deny if the PutObject does not have an s3:x-amz-acl header set to private.
options.C: Update the bucket policy to deny if the PutObject does not have an aws:SecureTransport header set to true.
options.D: Update the bucket policy to deny if the PutObject does not have an x-amz-server-side-encryption header set.

explanation: The x-amz-server-side-encryption header specifies server-side encryption for objects. A bucket policy denying PutObject without this header ensures all uploads are encrypted. ACL headers control access, not encryption. SecureTransport enforces HTTPS but doesn't enforce encryption at rest.
